title: Gamaredon's LittleDrifter USB malware spreads beyond Ukraine
description: A recently discovered worm that researchers call LittleDrifter has been spreading over USB drives infecting systems in multiple countries as part of a campaign from the Gamaredon state-sponsored espionage group. [...]

title: Microsoft fixes ‘Something Went Wrong’ Office sign-in errors
description: Microsoft is rolling out fixes for known Microsoft 365 issues causing 'Something Went Wrong [1001]' sign-in errors and rendering desktop applications unusable for many customers. [...]

title: VX-Underground malware collective framed by Phobos ransomware
description: A new Phobos ransomware variant frames the popular VX-Underground malware-sharing collective, indicating the group is behind attacks using the encryptor. [...]

title: Cybersecurity firm executive pleads guilty to hacking hospitals
description: The former chief operating officer of a cybersecurity company has pleaded guilty to hacking two hospitals, part of the Gwinnett Medical Center (GMC), in June 2021 to boost his company's business. [...]

title: Canadian government discloses data breach after contractor hacks
description: The Canadian government says two of its contractors have been hacked, exposing sensitive information belonging to an undisclosed number of government employees.  [...]

title: Kinsing malware exploits Apache ActiveMQ RCE to plant rootkits
description: The Kinsing malware operator is actively exploiting the CVE-2023-46604 critical vulnerability in the Apache ActiveMQ open-source message broker to compromise Linux systems. [...]

title: Rhysida ransomware gang claims British Library cyberattack
description: The Rhysida ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on the British Library in October, which has caused a major ongoing IT outage. [...]

title: How to boost Security with Self-Service Password Resets
description: Learn more from Specops Software about the benefits of self-service password resets and ways to accomplish this with on-premises Active Directory. [...]

title: Lumma Stealer malware now uses trigonometry to evade detection
description: The Lumma information-stealing malware is now using an interesting tactic to evade detection by security software - the measuring of mouse movements using trigonometry to determine if the malware is running on a real machine or an antivirus sandbox. [...]
